body_html:
There are a few performance regressions in indexing that I think are not mentioned here but would be good to keep in mind for before the release:

  • indexing a single dimension in a multi-dimensional tensor (which was before index_select), see #5159 (comment) .
  • indexing with a byte tensor of the same size of the tensor (which was before delegated to masked_select), see #3725 (comment)
body_text:
There are a few performance regressions in indexing that I think are not mentioned here but would be good to keep in mind for before the release:

 indexing a single dimension in a multi-dimensional tensor (which was before index_select), see  #5159 (comment) .
 indexing with a byte tensor of the same size of the tensor (which was before delegated to masked_select), see #3725 (comment)
body:
There are a few performance regressions in indexing that I think are not mentioned here but would be good to keep in mind for before the release:
- [ ] indexing a single dimension in a multi-dimensional tensor (which was before `index_select`), see  https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/5159#issuecomment-364627840 . 
- [ ] indexing with a byte tensor of the same size of the tensor (which was before delegated to `masked_select`), see https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/3725#issuecomment-345059385
